thread.title: Why transatlantic business relations can only get better
thread.title_full: Why transatlantic business relations can only get better

author: Myron Brilliant
title: Why transatlantic business relations can only get better
text:
T he relationship between the United States and the United Kingdom is a special one, built over generations upon a foundation of shared reverence for free enterprise, free markets and mutually beneficial trade.
Together, weâ€™ve fought and won two world wars, then constructed the international institutions that have undergirded decades of peace and economic prosperity.
The US business community watched with optimism as Prime Minister Theresa May came to Washington DC to meet with the president .
That the visit came at this early point in the work of the new administration was an encouraging signal that what binds our two countries will prevail as we navigate an ever changing global landscape.
Watch | UK-US trade deal in interest of both countries 00:31 T he UK is now confronting the unprecedented challenge of negotiating its exit from the European Union. Parliament has set in motion the process to enable the Prime Minister to soon get those talks under way,...
